Class InitialiseDB

java.lang.Object
InitialiseDB
public class InitialiseDB extends Object
Used to create the database file and give it its correct constraints, as specified by the DDLScript. It also deletes the database file if it is already present during runtime

      public InitialiseDB()

  • Method Details

    • emptyDBChecker

      public static boolean emptyDBChecker()
      Checks the database file and revises if there are tables inside. This is used to determine if the database has its tables either created or cleared.
      Returns:
      true if the database is empty and false if it is not

    • getSqlDeletionScript

      public static String getSqlDeletionScript()
      Standard getter for the SQL Script that clears the database file
      Returns:
      SQL Script that clears the database file

    • driverLoad

      public static void driverLoad() throws ClassNotFoundException
      Initialises the drivers for SQLite. This code was given during class in the W06 Example Code.
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException - if for some reason, the drivers cannot be installed

    • initialiseDB

      public static String initialiseDB(String SQLscriptPath)
      Initialises the database file and also gives it its constraints. If this is not done, tells the user the reason through messages. If the tables were already initialised, the method also drops them and recreates them. This is done to always start from scratch
      Parameters:
      SQLscriptPath - the path for the SQLScript (or any file that is supposed to take its role)
      Returns:
      the correspondent message depending on the outcome

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)

    • preparation

      public static Connection preparation() throws ClassNotFoundException, SQLException
      Initialises the SQLite drivers and also provides a connection to the database.
      Returns:
      a Connection object that is connected to the database.
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException - if the drivers could not be loaded.
      SQLException - if there is an issue with the Database.

    • deleteDB

      public static void deleteDB(List<String> perfectCommands, File SQLScript) throws ClassNotFoundException, SQLException, IOException
      Clears the database from its expected tables and relations.
      Parameters:
      perfectCommands - provided by the DDLTester, these are the valid commands to clear the database file.
      SQLScript - ideally the TableClearDDL.sql file. However, it can be any file. Its purpose is to contain the SQL Code to clear the database.
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException - if the drivers could not be loaded
      SQLException - if the SQL Code has a syntax problem
      IOException - if the SQLScript parameter cannot be read for some reason

    • getDatabaseFile

      public static String getDatabaseFile()

      Standard getter for the database file name.

      Returns:
      the database file name.

    • getSqlScript

      public static String getSqlScript()
      Returns the SQL_Script filepath as a string
      Returns:
      the correct SQL_SCRIPT Filepath as a string
